item.title: My new year!
item.description:
You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

To add new posts, simply add a file in the _posts directory that follows the convention YYYY-MM-DD-name-of-post.ext and includes the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for this post to get an idea about how it works.

Jekyll also offers powerful support for code snippets: 

def print_hi(name)
  puts "Hi, #{name}"
end
print_hi('Tom')
#=> prints 'Hi, Tom' to STDOUT.

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll’s dedicated Help repository.

item.title: Playing with UI
item.description:
AT&T You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

To add new posts, simply add a file in the _posts directory that follows the convention YYYY-MM-DD-name-of-post.ext and includes the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for this post to get an idea about how it works.

Trying out lists:

  • Item
  • Item 2
  • Item 3

Or Ordered lists

  1. Yo
  2. Is
  3. Cool

Nested Lists

  1. Item 1
    1. A corollary to the above item.
    2. Yet another point to consider.
  2. Item 2
    • A corollary that does not need to be ordered.
      • This is indented four spaces, because it’s two spaces further than the item above.
      • You might want to consider makign a new list.
  3. Item 3

In the words of Abraham Lincoln:

Pardon my french

This text will be italic

This text will be bold

Everyone must attend the meeting at 5 o’clock today.

Check out this neat program I wrote:

x = 2 x = 2 + 2 what is x

item.title: This is new
item.description:
You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

My studio (@BrotherhoodIO) is currently looking for new projects. Get in touch if you’re interested! (Any retweets appreciated) :)

— ғάвισ ↬ (@fffabs) November 7, 2014

To add new posts, simply add a file in the _posts directory that follows the convention YYYY-MM-DD-name-of-post.ext and includes the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for this post to get an idea about how it works.

Jekyll also offers powerful support for code snippets:

layerA.animate
    properties:
        x:200
    curve: "ease-in-out"

layerA.on Events.AnimationEnd, ->
    layerA.animate
        properties:
            x:100
        curve: "ease-in-out"

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll’s dedicated Help repository.

item.title: Welcome to Jekyll!
item.description:
